page.title: 01Leinthall Earls
page.content: This area includes village of Leinthall Earls and land to north and east. Village lies in small valley and land rises steeply on eiter side. It is a very rural, unspoilt area with scattered dwellings amongst wooded and forested hills. Much of the land is covered with deciduous and coniferous forests. Where forests do no exist the hill slopes are predominantly grasslands a mixture of intensively managed grassland and enclosed rough grazing on steeper areas. Population of the area are mainly concerned with agriculture.The only other significant source of employment is stone quarry to the north of Leinthall Earls. One mile north east of Leinthall earls is Gatley Park which is home of the Lord Lieutenant of Herefordshire. The area, being quite steep, is served by very few roads 'C7 class roads
